title: Inspiring Speeches
main_text:
I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.” Martin Luther King Jr.

'Freedom or Death' by Emmeline Pankhurst

'The Emancipation Proclamation' by Abraham Lincoln

'Professions for Women' by Virginia Woolf

'A Room of One's Own - Shakespeare's Sister' by Virginia Woolf

'Wind of Change' by Harold MacMillan

'Weapons for squalid and trivial ends' by Aneurin Bevan

'The lady's not for turning' by Margaret Thatcher

'The flame of French resistance' by Charles de Gaulle

'On the Cult of Personality and Its Consequences' by Nikita Khrushchev

'Inaugural Address' by Franklin D. Roosevelt

'I am Prepared to Die' by Nelson Mandela

'I Have a Dream' by Dr. Martin Luther King

'We Shall Fight on the Beaches' by Winston Churchill

'Inaugural Address' by John F. Kennedy

'Gettysburg Address' by Abraham Lincoln

'A Tryst with Destiny' by Jawaharlal Nehru
